arm_group.description: 35 mg/Kg of grape seed proanthocyanidins extract (2 capsules)

brief_summary.textblock:
Grape seed proanthocyanidins have been reported to possess a hypotriglyceridemic effect
      after an acute or chronic consumption in rodents. In this study, we aimed to investigate the
      effects of an acute consumption of proanthocyanidins before a breakfast meal in humans.
      Moreover, the mechanisms implicated in the reduction of plasma triglycerides levels by grape
      seed proanthocyanidins in humans should be elucidated as well as its activity on vascular
      function.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ability of Grape Seed Proanthocyanidins to Reduce Postprandial Triglycerides in Humans

detailed_description.textblock:
The intervention will consist in the administration of 2 capsules containing the grape seed
      proanthocyanidins extract or 2 empty capsules (placebo) just before breakfast, which will
      consist of 100g of white bread, 75g of salami, 50g of fatty cheese, 125g of yogurt (10%
      fat), 25ml of olive oil and water ad libitum. The nutritional composition of this meal is as
      follows: 1.200 Kcal of energy content, 15% of energy from proteins, 22% from carbohydrates
      and 63% from fat (35% saturated fat), and 120mg of cholesterol. Blood samples will be taken
      at point 0.5,1,2,3 and 6 hours after breakfast. Moreover, urine samples will be collected at
      time 0 and 6 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adults between the ages of 20 and 40

          -  Signing the informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Body mass index (BMI) lower than 18.5 or greater than 27 Kg/m2

          -  Smokers

          -  Regular medication

          -  Consumption of medication during the last week

          -  Following a weight-loss diet

          -  Vegetarians

          -  Abnormal glucose levels

          -  Diabetes

          -  Cardiovascular disease

          -  Gastrointestinal disease

          -  Anemia

          -  Nuts allergy

intervention.intervention_name: 35 mg/Kg of grape seed proanthocyanidins extract (2 capsules)

facility.name: Technological Center of Nutrition and Health (CTNS)

clinical_study.official_title: Ability of Grape Seed Proanthocyanidins to Reduce Postprandial Triglycerides in Humans

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve of plasma triglycerides concentration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

secondary_outcome.measure: Endothelial function (assessed by ischemic reactive hyperemia)
Blood lipid levels, markers of inflammation and oxidation
Markers of cholesterol metabolism in PBMCs (mRNA and protein).
Membrane lipid composition of erythrocytes and oxidation markers.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
